intro: Hypoestes distans, commonly known as the "Rainbow Plant," is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, colorful bracts that resemble flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its blooming period occurs during the warmer months, producing clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of red, yellow, and orange. Hypoestes distans is popular in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soil with moderate sunlight.
